Your Daily Briefing

Saturday, February 21, 2026
Weather · News · Podcasts · Research
Weather in New York City
Partly Sunny — High 47° / Low 36°
Time Temp Conditions Precip Humidity Wind
3pm 46°F Partly Sunny 0% 51% 10 mph NW
5pm 44°F Partly Sunny 0% 54% 8 mph NW
7pm 43°F Mostly Cloudy 2% 58% 8 mph N
♦
Top News
Sat, 21 Feb 2026 21:05:18 GMT  •  BBC News
Nasa astronauts' moon mission delayed due to rocket issue
NASA's Artemis II mission, aiming to send four astronauts on a 10-day trip around the Moon for the first time in 50 years, is delayed from its early March launch window. NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman confirmed the delay Saturday after engineers found an interruption in helium flow during a 50-hour fueling test that used 730,000 gallons of propellant. This technical issue, involving helium for fuel tank pressurization and rocket cooling, will "almost assuredly impact the March window."
Sat, 21 Feb 2026 20:58:00 GMT  •  ABC7 New York
Blizzard, winter storm warnings issued, could be biggest in decade | Live updates
The Tri-State area is under its first blizzard warning since March 2017, with a powerful winter storm expected to deliver 12 to 18 inches of snow from Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. Wind gusts topping 50 mph could bring down trees, cause power outages, and contribute to 2.5 to 3 feet of coastal flooding. Snowfall rates could reach 2-3 inches per hour during the storm's peak, making travel extremely dangerous.
Sat, 21 Feb 2026 15:52:33 -0500  •  NPR
Mississippi health system shuts down clinics statewide after ransomware attack
The University of Mississippi Medical Center (UMMC) closed all 35 of its clinics statewide and canceled appointments, including chemotherapy and elective procedures, after a ransomware attack compromised its phone and electronic systems on Thursday. UMMC Vice Chancellor LouAnn Woodward stated Friday that the medical center is working with the FBI to resolve the system outage and is using paper documentation for ongoing patient care. UMMC hospitals and emergency departments remain operational.
Sat, 21 Feb 2026 20:50:06 GMT  •  BBC News
Trump says he will increase his new global tariffs to 15%
Donald Trump announced on Truth Social Saturday that he will impose 15% global tariffs, the maximum allowed under a never-used 1974 trade law that permits them for about five months without congressional approval. This follows a 6-3 Supreme Court decision Friday, which struck down his previous import taxes under a 1977 law, finding he had overstepped his powers. The previous tariffs had collected at least $130 billion for the US.
Sat, 21 Feb 2026 15:45:31 -0500  •  NPR
Blizzard conditions and high winds forecast for NYC, East coast
The National Weather Service (NWS) has issued blizzard warnings for millions across New Jersey, Delaware, Long Island, New York City, and southern Connecticut from Sunday morning through Monday afternoon. Up to 17 inches of snow is expected in New York City, with potential for nearly two feet, and NYC Mayor Zohran Mamdani advised residents to stay off the roads. New Jersey Gov. Mikie Sherrill declared a state of emergency effective midday Sunday, as gusts up to 70 mph and snowfall rates of 2 inches per hour are forecast.
♦
Podcast Episodes
2026-02-21  •  This Week in Startups
We Asked 3 Experts How to Get More Value out of OpenClaw | E2253
Jordy Coltman from the WeeklyClaw newsletter highlighted **common time-wasting mistakes for OpenClaw beginners** and suggested **new hardware is the optimal environment** for agents. **Tremaine Grant** of PulsePLUS demonstrated his companyâ€™s **"virtual office" interface** and a "Heartbeat Protocol" for agent interaction. Separately, **Jesse Leimgruber** showcased his **OpenHome AI smart speakers** for integrating AI into smart homes.
2026-02-20  •  AI Daily Brief
Does Gemini 3.1 Pro Matter?
The podcast indicated that **Accenture ties employee promotions directly to the adoption of AI** within the company. This corporate policy highlights the growing emphasis on AI integration for professional advancement across the enterprise sector.
2026-02-20  •  Morning Brew Daily
Tariffs Ineffective Against US Trade Deficit? & Family Feud Over Reeseâ€™s Recipe
Hosts Neal and Toby discussed how the **US trade deficit widened by 2.1% compared to 2024**, reaching approximately **$1.2 trillion**, despite former President Trumpâ€™s aggressive tariffs. The grandson of the **Reeseâ€™s Peanut Butter Cup inventor publicly criticized Hersheyâ€™s** for allegedly using cheaper ingredients. Etsy **sold its secondhand marketplace to eBay**, a move investors responded positively to. Amazon **snapped a 9-day losing streak** that had resulted in the company **losing $450 billion in market value**.
2026-02-19  •  This Week in Startups
When Will Openclaw go Mainstream? | E2252
Matthew believes OpenClaw is **not yet ready for mainstream consumers**, noting that only **10% of people are technical enough to install it**. Ryan, however, sees OpenClaw as providing consumers **access to previously unattainable opportunities**. The episode also mentioned that **Anthropic patched the ability to use OpenClaw** through its Pro plan, and **Peter Steinberger**, OpenClaw's creator, **is joining OpenAI**.
2026-02-19  •  AI Daily Brief
How People Actually Use AI Agents
The podcast indicated that **Accenture links employee promotions to the adoption of AI** within the company. This corporate strategy underscores the increasing importance of **AI integration for career growth** within large organizations.
♦
AI Security Papers
2026-02-18  •  Johannes Bertram, Jonas Geiping
NESSiE: The Necessary Safety Benchmark -- Identifying Errors that should not Exist
safety
Researchers introduced **NESSiE**, a **lightweight safety benchmark** for LLMs, which uses **minimal information and access security test cases** to identify **safety-relevant failures** that should not exist given low task complexity. Passing NESSiE is considered **necessary for any LLM deployment**.
2026-02-18  •  Sasha Behrouzi, Lichao Wu, Mohamadreza Rostami et al.
NeST: Neuron Selective Tuning for LLM Safety
safety
The paper proposes **NeST (Neuron Selective Tuning)** as a novel method for **LLM safety alignment**, aiming to overcome the **high costs of heavyweight fine-tuning** and the **inconsistent safety gains** of parameter-efficient methods like LoRA.
2026-02-17  •  Zarif Ikram, Arad Firouzkouhi, Stephen Tu et al.
CrispEdit: Low-Curvature Projections for Scalable Non-Destructive LLM Editing
Researchers introduce **CrispEdit**, a **scalable and principled second-order algorithm** for non-destructive LLM editing that treats **capability preservation as an explicit constraint**. This method aims to prevent the corruption of general capabilities during targeted behavior changes, unifying and generalizing existing editing approaches.
2026-02-16  •  Dongrui Liu, Yi Yu, Jie Zhang et al.
Frontier AI Risk Management Framework in Practice: A Risk Analysis Technical Report v1.5
agentic AI
The **Frontier AI Risk Management Framework in Practice v1.5** presents an updated and granular assessment of **five critical risk dimensions** for rapidly advancing AI models, including **cyber offense and persuasion and manipulation**. This report aims to identify unprecedented risks from evolving LLM capabilities and the proliferation of agentic AI.
2026-02-16  •  Yixin Zhang, Ziyi Wang, Yiming Rong et al.
World Models for Policy Refinement in StarCraft II
This paper proposes a method to integrate a **learnable, action-conditioned transition model** into the decision loop of LLM-based StarCraft II agents, a gap in existing approaches that primarily focus on policy improvement. This addresses the challenge of **StarCraft II's massive state-action space and partial observability**.
♦
AI Security News
Fri, 20 Feb 2026 17:30:32 GMT  •  Security Boulevard
Using threat modeling and prompt injection to audit Comet
Perplexity hired auditors to test its AI-powered Comet browser before launch, where they used the TRAIL threat model and four prompt injection techniques to exploit the browser's AI assistant. Auditors demonstrated how these techniques could extract users' private Gmail information to an attacker's server, as shown in an April 2025 audit video. The vulnerabilities stemmed from the browser's AI agents failing to treat external content as untrusted input.
Fri, 20 Feb 2026 11:41:32 GMT  •  CybersecurityNews
LLM-Generated Passwords Expose Major Security Flaws with Predictability, Repetition, and Weakness
New research reveals that LLM-generated passwords are significantly weaker than they seem, lacking the true randomness of cryptographically secure generators due to LLMs' predictive nature. Claude Opus 4.6 produced only 30 unique passwords across 50 runs, with one appearing 18 times (36% probability), while GPT-5.2 passwords nearly all started with "v" and Gemini 3 Flash with "K" or "k". Passwords from Claude Opus 4.6 showed only 27 bits of entropy and GPT-5.2 just 20 bits, making them vulnerable to cracking in seconds, and changing model temperature did not resolve the issue.
Thu, 19 Feb 2026 14:00:15 GMT  •  Institutional Investor
OpenClaw: The AI Agent Institutional Investors Need to Understand â€” But Shouldn't Touch
OpenClaw, an autonomous AI agent released in November 2025, has amassed 300,000 to 400,000 users and demonstrates genuine productivity by clearing thousands of emails and automating calendar management. While a breakthrough in capability, it is not enterprise-ready due to security vulnerabilities and lack of governance, despite its local-first architecture offering a privacy advantage by keeping data on the user's server.
Tue, 17 Feb 2026 12:24:18 GMT  •  Security Boulevard
Large Language Model (LLM) integration risks for SaaS and enterprise
The rapid integration of LLMs into SaaS and enterprise applications is creating new security vulnerabilities, with deployments outpacing the adaptation of security models. The primary risk lies in the integration layer, where LLMs gain contextual access to sensitive data via user prompts, application context, and internal systems, creating a new trust boundary. Unlike traditional applications, LLM interfaces are open-ended and conversational, making them susceptible to prompt injection attacks that manipulate model behavior.

🎙️ Podcast Episodes
2026-02-19  ·  This Week in Startups
When Will Openclaw go Mainstream? | E2252
In This Week in Startups E2252, Matthew asserted that Openclaw is not ready for mainstream consumers as only 10% of people possess the technical skills to install it. Ryan suggested Openclaw could empower consumers with unprecedented opportunities, while Jason voiced skepticism regarding the Openclaw Foundation. Anthropic has reportedly patched the ability to use Openclaw through its pro plan, and Ryan predicts a new Openclaw fork will emerge soon. Additionally, Openclaw's creator Peter Steinberger is moving to OpenAI, not to work on Openclaw, raising concerns he might "orphan" the project.
 
2026-02-17  ·  This Week in Startups
Will OpenAI Tank OpenClaw? | E2251
In This Week in Startups E2251, guests Hiten Shah and Jesse Genet joined Jason to discuss concerns about OpenAI hiring OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger, with Jason predicting OpenAI will provide personalized closed-source assistants. Hiten Shah live-trained an OpenClaw skill based on Jason's book "Angel", demonstrating practical application. Jesse Genet showcased her "vibe-coded" app designed to aggregate non-Slop videos for her family, noting her Mac Minis now outnumber her children. John Arrow, creator of AI Scott Adams, explained his inspiration for cloning the iconic podcaster.
 
2026-02-14  ·  This Week in Startups
OpenClaw is Our Friend Now | E2250
In This Week in Startups E2250, Ryan Carson showcased AntFarm, his open-source tool enabling AI agents with specialized roles to collaboratively complete complex tasks. David Im presented Clawra, his AI virtual girlfriend designed to learn user tastes and even purchase presents, sparking discussion about programming AI companions. Alex Liteplo demonstrated RentAHuman, a marketplace where AI bots can pay real people in stablecoins for IRL tasks, citing an example of hiring "100 goth girls" to hold signs in Times Square. The episode explored the evolving social and collaborative dynamics between humans and advanced AIs.
📄 AI Security Papers
2026-02-18  ·  Zun Li, John Schultz, Daniel Hennes et al.
Discovering Multiagent Learning Algorithms with Large Language Models
This paper proposes AlphaEvolve, an evolutionary approach, to discover **Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (MARL) algorithms**. This method aims to reduce the reliance on human intuition in developing variants for foundational **MARL** families like **Counterfactual Regret Minimization (CFR)** and **Policy Space Response Oracles (PSRO)**.
 
2026-02-17  ·  Xiaoze Liu, Ruowang Zhang, Weichen Yu et al.
The Vision Wormhole: Latent-Space Communication in Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Systems
This paper introduces The Vision Wormhole, a method for latent state transfer in heterogeneous Multi-Agent Systems (MAS). This approach overcomes the inefficiencies of discrete text communication, which causes significant runtime overhead and information quantization loss, thereby improving scalability and modularity across diverse agent architectures.
 
2026-02-17  ·  Chansung Park, Juyong Jiang, Fan Wang et al.
TAROT: Test-driven and Capability-adaptive Curriculum Reinforcement Fine-tuning for Code Generation with Large Language Models
This paper presents TAROT, a Test-driven and Capability-adaptive Curriculum Reinforcement Fine-tuning (RFT) method designed for code generation with Large Language Models (LLMs). TAROT improves the synthesis of algorithmically sophisticated code by incentivizing deep reasoning capabilities and managing the heterogeneous difficulty and granularity of test cases.
 
2026-02-16  ·  Dongrui Liu, Yi Yu, Jie Zhang et al.
Frontier AI Risk Management Framework in Practice: A Risk Analysis Technical Report v1.5
agentic AI
This technical report (v1.5) provides an updated and granular assessment of **frontier AI risks**, focusing on dimensions such as **cyber offense** and **persuasion and manipulation**. It aims to identify and understand unprecedented risks posed by rapidly advancing **AI models**, especially with the proliferation of **agentic AI**.
 
2026-02-16  ·  Yixin Zhang, Ziyi Wang, Yiming Rong et al.
World Models for Policy Refinement in StarCraft II
This paper proposes using World Models for policy refinement in **StarCraft II (SC2)**, a complex environment with massive state-action space and partial observability. This approach integrates a learnable, action-conditioned transition model into the decision loop for LLM-based SC2 agents, addressing a gap where existing agents primarily focus on policy improvement.
🛡 AI Security News
Sun, 07 Dec 2025 08:00:00 GMT  ·  Qualys
LLM Security | Prevent Vulnerabilities & Boost Application Security | Qualys
The global LLM market is projected to surge from $1.59 billion in 2023 to $259.8 billion by 2030, representing a CAGR of 79.80%. By 2025, an estimated 750 million apps are expected to integrate LLMs, with the top five developers capturing 88.22% of 2023's market revenue. LLMs face significant security vulnerabilities including data poisoning, targeted attacks, and response manipulation due to their inherent complexity and open architecture.
 
Fri, 19 Sep 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  Qualys
OWASP Top 10 LLM Risks 2025: Key AI Security Updates
The OWASP Top 10 for LLM Applications 2025 lists Prompt Injection as the top risk, with Sensitive Information Disclosure and Supply Chain climbing to second and third place respectively from 2023. New entries include System Prompt Leakage, which highlights how embedded information in prompts can compromise confidentiality, and Vector and Embedding Weaknesses, focusing on vulnerabilities in Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). The list also expanded Misinformation to include Overreliance, and Unbounded Consumption now covers resource management and unexpected operational costs beyond just Denial of Service.
 
Mon, 28 Jul 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  Fujitsu Global
Next-generation security through AI agent collaboration: Proactively addressing vulnerabilities and emerging threats
Fujitsu has developed Multi-AI agent security technology to proactively counter cyberattacks and vulnerabilities within generative AI apps, published on July 28, 2025. This technology employs three distinct AI agents: an Attack AI agent that creates attack scenarios, a Defense AI agent that proposes countermeasures, and a Test AI agent that simulates attacks in a virtual environment. The system comprises "System-Protecting" Security AI Agent Technology and "Generative AI-Protecting" Generative AI Security Enhancement Technology.
 
Thu, 12 Jun 2025 01:15:38 GMT  ·  TrendMicro
Stay Ahead of AI Threats: Secure LLM Applications With Trend Vision One
Only 37% of organizations have processes to assess the security of AI tools before deployment, according to the World Economic Forum's Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2025. Trend Micro's Trend Vision Oneâ„¢ platform addresses nine of the OWASP Top 10 LLM Risks (2025), integrating features like ZTSA AI Secure Access to inspect traffic to AI services. Its AI Application Security includes an AI Scanner for risk detection and AI Guard to block attacks such as prompt injection and data leakage.

Ryan Carson introduced AntFarm, his open-source tool for collaborative AI agents with specialized roles working together on complex tasks. David Im showcased Clawra, an AI virtual girlfriend that learns preferences, buys presents, and raises questions about introducing it to an IRL girlfriend. Alex Liteplo presented RentAHuman, a marketplace where AI agents pay real people in stablecoins to complete IRL tasks, such as hiring 100 goth girls to hold signs in Times Square. The hosts also discussed the security implications of AI companions and pondered whether robots could be better bosses than humans.
 
2026-02-12  ·  This Week in Startups
Why J-Cal Invested to 200K in a former Employee | E2249
Jason invested $200,000 in Preshâ€™s startup, The Wellness Company, which developed the Tempo app for monitoring health and offering proactive advice. Presh detailed how Tempo finds engagement and emphasized the importance of Product Velocity and World-Class Design. Peter Cetale presented Sourcerer, a company that uses AI agents to help U.S. firms and distributors find better prices for mass-produced goods, successfully bringing costs down. Peter discussed his experience in a16zâ€™s Speedrun accelerator, noting the impact of Tariff Mania on his business and his belief in leaner startups with cheaper compute.

A pre-registered, investigator-blinded, randomized controlled trial (June-August 2025; n = 153) evaluated whether LLMs improve novice performance in tasks modeling a viral reverse genetics workflow.

The paper highlights that while additional inference computation helps LLMs, similar scaling is challenging in VLMs because visual inputs are typically provided only once, leading to increasingly text-dominated reasoning.

Causality is Key for Interpretability Claims to Generalise
The paper posits that causal inference is crucial for validating claims of interpretability in LLMs, specifically using Pearl's causal hierarchy to define valid mappings from model activations to invariant high-level structures.

The Vision Wormhole: Latent-Space Communication in Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Systems
This paper introduces a method for latent state transfer in heterogeneous Multi-Agent Systems (MAS), addressing the inefficiency of discrete text communication by enabling high-bandwidth, scalable, and modular communication across diverse architectures.

Mon, 09 Feb 2026 08:00:00 GMT  ·  The Hacker News
âš¡ Weekly Recap: AI Skill Malware, 31Tbps DDoS, Notepad++ Hack, LLM Backdoors and More
OpenClaw partnered with Google's VirusTotal to scan skills uploaded to ClawHub after cybersecurity concerns rose regarding prompt injections and data exfiltration in autonomous AI tools. Trend Micro reported malicious actors on Exploit.in discussing using OpenClaw skills for botnet operations, and Veracode found over 1,000 "claw" packages on npm and PyPI by early February 2026. These developments highlight how attackers are abusing trusted updates, marketplaces, and AI workflows, leading to an expanding threat surface.
 
Sun, 07 Dec 2025 08:00:00 GMT  ·  Qualys
LLM Security | Prevent Vulnerabilities & Boost Application Security | Qualys
The global LLM market is projected to surge from $1,590 million in 2023 to $259,800 million by 2030, with 750 million apps expected to integrate LLMs by 2025. Despite rapid adoption, LLMs face security risks like data poisoning, targeted attacks, and response manipulation due to their complexity and openness to external inputs. These vulnerabilities threaten the reliability of LLMs and the protection of sensitive information across industries like healthcare and finance.
 
Fri, 19 Sep 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  Qualys
OWASP Top 10 LLM Risks 2025: Key AI Security Updates
The OWASP Top 10 for LLM Applications 2025, finalized in late 2024, updates and adds entries to address emerging AI security risks, with Prompt Injection remaining at number one. Sensitive Information Disclosure and Supply Chain jumped to second and third place, while new entries include System Prompt Leakage and Vector and Embedding Weaknesses. Categories like Misinformation and Unbounded Consumption were expanded, and Excessive Agency now highlights risks from unchecked permissions in autonomous AI systems.
 
Mon, 28 Jul 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  Fujitsu Global
Next-generation security through AI agent collaboration: Proactively addressing vulnerabilities and emerging threats
Fujitsu developed Multi-AI agent security technology, published on July 28, 2025, which uses multiple autonomously operating AI agents to proactively counter cyberattacks and address vulnerabilities in generative AI apps. The System-Protecting Security AI Agent Technology includes an Attack AI agent creating scenarios, a Defense AI agent proposing countermeasures, and a Test AI agent simulating attacks and validating defenses. This technology enables system administrators without specialized security expertise to implement appropriate measures against complex system configurations and an increasing number of vulnerabilities.

Former President Donald Trump's foreign policy relies heavily on personal relationships, sidelining traditional State Department diplomacy. His administration notably used Jared Kushner for delicate negotiations, leading to the Abraham Accords without extensive career diplomat involvement.
Wed, 18 Feb 2026 02:49:00 GMT  ·  The Wall Street Journal
â€˜Wokeâ€™ AI Feud Escalates Between Pentagon and Anthropic
The Pentagon and Anthropic are in a dispute over **Claude AI's** refusal to generate content like a Marine Corps recruitment poster due to safety concerns. This has led the Department of Defense to review its existing AI ethics guidelines, intensifying the debate over 'woke' AI models.
Wed, 18 Feb 2026 05:34:04 GMT  ·  The Washington Post
DHS spokeswoman who became a face of Trump deportation campaign steps down
Kathryn Rexrode, a prominent spokeswoman for the Department of Homeland Security during the Trump administration, has stepped down from her position. She was a key public defender of the administration's stringent immigration policies, including actions related to family separations at the U.S.-Mexico border.
🎙️ Podcast Episodes
2026-02-17  ·  This Week in Startups
Will OpenAI Tank OpenClaw? | E2251
Jason predicts OpenAI will offer personalized, closed-source AI assistants to everyone, potentially impacting the open-source community. Guest Hiten Shah demonstrated an OpenClaw "personal CRM" for investors, while Jesse Genet showcased her family media aggregator, hinting at new business models. Additionally, John Arrow, creator of **AI Scott Adams**, explained how his AI clone adapts over time and why it sparked widespread online controversy.
2026-02-14  ·  This Week in Startups
OpenClaw is Our Friend Now | E2250
Guest Ryan Carson presented AntFarm, an open-source tool utilizing specialized OpenClaw agents to collaborate on complex tasks. David Im introduced Clawra, an AI virtual girlfriend that learns user preferences and can buy virtual presents, sparking discussion on AI companions. Alex Liteplo showcased RentAHuman, a marketplace where **AI agents pay real people in stablecoins** to complete **IRL tasks**, like hiring 100 goth girls to hold signs in Times Square.
2026-02-12  ·  This Week in Startups
Why J-Cal Invested to 200K in a former Employee | E2249
Jason invested $200K in former employee Presh Dineshkumar's startup, The Wellness Company, for their **Tempo app**, which monitors health and offers proactive advice. Peter Cetale, CEO of Sourcerer and an a16z Speedrun accelerator alum, leverages AI agents to help US firms find the best prices for mass-produced goods. Sourcerer achieves significant cost reductions by deploying agents on both the supply and demand sides of the market.
2026-02-12  ·  This Week in Startups
How These 3 Founders are building on Open Claw | E2248
Presh Dineshkumar developed Eywa, an OpenClaw Replicant that spies on his emails to track active users and fix bugs in his apps. Sean Liu successfully integrated his Meta Ray-Bans with his **OpenClaw** instance, enabling interaction with visible real-world context. Vishnu created a product to simplify OpenClaw setup and security for non-technical users. Both Vishnu and Sean accepted Jason's $125K investment deal to pursue their OpenClaw projects.
2026-02-12  ·  Lex Fridman Podcast
#491 â€“ OpenClaw: The Viral AI Agent that Broke the Internet â€“ Peter Steinberger
Peter Steinberger, creator of OpenClaw, revealed that the project went viral due to its ability to enable self-modifying AI agents, offering unprecedented user control. He disclosed that both OpenAI and Meta made acquisition offers for OpenClaw, which he declined. Steinberger predicts that AI agents will replace 80% of current apps, fundamentally changing software interaction. He also detailed specific security challenges inherent to **OpenClaw's** system access.
📄 AI Security Papers

agentic AI
This paper introduces **BrowseComp-V^3**, a novel visual, vertical, and verifiable benchmark for multimodal browsing agents (MLLMs) that offers enhanced task complexity. It provides a more comprehensive and reproducible assessment of deep search capabilities for autonomous web-browsing MLLMs.
2026-02-17  ·  Zarif Ikram, Arad Firouzkouhi, Stephen Tu et al.
CrispEdit: Low-Curvature Projections for Scalable Non-Destructive LLM Editing
The paper presents **CrispEdit**, a scalable second-order editing algorithm for large language models (LLMs) that explicitly constrains capability preservation. This method unifies existing approaches and successfully prevents the degradation of general capabilities during targeted behavior modifications.
2026-02-17  ·  Yuqi Tian, Robert Paine, Attila Dobi et al.
Decision Quality Evaluation Framework at Pinterest
safety
Pinterest developed a comprehensive **Decision Quality Evaluation Framework** to robustly assess content moderation decisions by human agents and LLMs at scale. This framework addresses inherent trade-offs between cost, scale, and trustworthiness in enforcing evolving content safety policies.
2026-02-17  ·  Max Springer, Chung Peng Lee, Blossom Metevier et al.
The Geometry of Alignment Collapse: When Fine-Tuning Breaks Safety
adversarial safety guardrail
This research reveals that fine-tuning aligned language models on benign tasks can unpredictably degrade safety guardrails because the orthogonality of fine-tuning updates to safety-critical directions is structurally unstable. The authors demonstrate this instability collapses under the dynamics of gradient descent.
2026-02-17  ·  Shiqi Liu, Zeyu He, Guojian Zhan et al.
STAPO: Stabilizing Reinforcement Learning for LLMs by Silencing Rare Spurious Tokens
This paper introduces **STAPO**, a method to stabilize reinforcement learning (RL) fine-tuning for LLMs by silencing rare spurious tokens. **STAPO** prevents late-stage performance collapse and improves reasoning quality by addressing the negative correlation between token-wise policy gradient magnitude and token probability/local policy entropy.
